publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4961 Scott Barrie: Munros for All—That the Parliament notes the 150th anniversary of the birth of Sir Hugh Thomas Munro who was the first person to chart Scotland’s hills and mountains over 3,000 feet; further notes that the Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2003 makes it easier than ever to enjoy Scotland’s natural heritage; congratulates the roughly 3,500 people who have "bagged" every Munro, and encourages Scots and non-Scots alike to enjoy the Munro experience.
S2M-4961 Munros for All (lodged on 17 October 2006) Maureen Macmillan*

S2M-4961 Munros for All (lodged on 17 October 2006) Jackie Baillie*, Cathie Craigie*, Pauline McNeill*, Alex Neil*, Christine May*, Robin Harper*, Bill Butler*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Frances Curran*, Margaret Smith*, Des McNulty*, Mr John Swinney*, Michael McMahon*, Karen Whitefield*, Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, John Swinburne*, Trish Godman*
S2M-4961 Munros for All (lodged on 17 October 2006) Mrs Nanette Milne*, Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-4961 Munros for All (lodged on 17 October 2006) Ms Maureen Watt*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-4961 Munros for All (lodged on 17 October 2006) Dennis Canavan*
S2M-4961 Munros for All (lodged on 17 October 2006) Shiona Baird*, Donald Gorrie*
